intro: Harpalyce magnibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Harpalyce magnibracteata is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
